intro: Microparacaryum, commonly known as the small paracaryum, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. These plants are typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. They are characterized by their small, delicate leaves and rhizomatous growth habit. Microparacaryum species often form dense underwater mats, contributing to water clarity by stabilizing sediments. Their botanical significance lies in their role in aquatic ecosystems and their use in ornamental aquatic gardening.
